post.content:
Deploying Pizza demo to your VAJ 3.5
Source code url for this text - http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/java/pattern/vaj/pizza1/
Jul 28, 2001 Scott Lee , rojaware@bigfoot.com
1. create directory name 'pizza' under your X:/VAJ3.5/ide/project_resources/IBM Websphere Test Environment /hosts/default_hosts/default_app/web/html/ (X:/VAJ3.5 - your drive and root path name for VAJ installation. Adjust this with your current setting)
2. Copy PizzaForm.html to your X:/VAJ3.5/ide/project_resources/IBM Websphere Test Environment /hosts/default_hosts/default_app/web/html/pizza
3. Create sub directory 'java_source' under your X:/VAJ3.5/ide/project_resources/IBM Websphere Test Environment /hosts/default_hosts/default_app/web/ (X:/VAJ3.5 - your drive and root path name for VAJ installation. Adjust this with your current setting)
4. Export your PizzaServlet.java from VAJ workspace to your X:/VAJ3.5/ide/project_resources/IBM Websphere Test Environment /hosts/default_hosts/default_app/web/java_source/ (X:/VAJ3.5 - your drive and root path name for VAJ installation. Adjust this with your current setting)
5. Open your VAJ workspace Create new project named 'Pizza' import 'PizzaServlet.java' to this project, no package name is required for this at now.
6. Start your servlet engine in WTE(Websphere Test Environment) From workspace, click 'workspace-> tool -> Websphere Test Environment. You will have 'Websphere Test Environment' dialog box. Select 'Edit Classpath' to update your new project in directory path because this directory has your own servlet
7. You will see all project list in your workspace in this dialog box. Select 'Websphere Test Environment' and 'Pizza' as your own project. Then WTE remembers this class.
8. Click 'Start Servlet Engine' button to start sevlet engine
9. Open your browser and type 'http://localhost:8080/html/pizza/PizzaForm.html'
It will display pizza order screen. Type any text and press OrderPizza. Next screen will come back to you display the result.
